30 (R ecommended) Suppose A x = Ax . If A = 0 then x is in lhe nullspace. If), t= 0 
then x is in the column space. Those spaces have dimensions en - r) + r = II. 
SO why doesn't every square malrill have II linearly independent eigenvectors?
